paper_abstract: Our aim is to present what we call the lower and the upper hierarchy of the real valued probability logics with probability operators of the form P->= s and Q(F), where s is an element of [0,1](Q) = [0, 1] boolean AND Q and F is a recursive subset of [0,1](Q). The intended meaning of P->= s alpha is that the probability of a is at least s, while the intended meaning of Q(F)alpha is that the probability of alpha is in F. (C) 2014 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
